meta.name: accordion
meta.description: An accordion allows users to toggle the display of sections of content. Each accordion consists of a header with a title and content area.

meta.name: badge
meta.description: A badge is a small label that can be used to display information or status.

meta.name: breadcrumbs
meta.description: Breadcrumbs display a heirarchy of links to the current page or resource in an application.

meta.name: button
meta.description: A button allows a user to perform an action, with mouse, touch, and keyboard interactions.

meta.name: calendar
meta.description: A calendar displays one or more date grids and allows users to select either a single date or a contiguous range of dates.

meta.name: card
meta.description: Displays a card with header, content, and footer.

meta.name: checkbox
meta.description: A checkbox allows a user to select multiple items from a list of individual items, or to mark one individual item as selected.

meta.name: combobox
meta.description: A combo box combines a text input with a listbox, allowing users to filter a list of options to items matching a query.

meta.name: command
meta.description: A command palette that allows users to quickly search and execute commands using keyboard shortcuts.

meta.name: date-field
meta.description: A date field allows users to enter and edit date and time values using a keyboard. Each part of a date value is displayed in an individually editable segment.

meta.name: date-picker
meta.description: A date picker combines one or more DateFields with a calendar popover, allowing users to enter or select a single date/time or a range.

meta.name: input
meta.description: Allows a user to enter a plain text value with a keyboard.

meta.name: menu
meta.description: A menu displays a list of actions or options that a user can choose.

meta.name: meter
meta.description: A meter represents a quantity within a known range, or a fractional value.

meta.name: modal
meta.description: A modal is an overlay element which blocks interaction with elements outside it.

meta.name: popover
meta.description: A popover is an overlay element positioned relative to a trigger.

meta.name: radio-group
meta.description: A radio group allows a user to select a single option from a list of mutually exclusive options.

meta.name: select
meta.description: A select displays a collapsible list of options and allows a user to select one of them.

meta.name: slider
meta.description: A slider allows a user to select one or more values within a range.

meta.name: switch
meta.description: A switch allows a user to turn a setting on or off.

meta.name: table
meta.description: A table displays data in rows and columns and enables a user to navigate its contents via directional navigation keys, and optionally supports row selection and sorting.

meta.name: tabs
meta.description: Tabs organize content into multiple sections and allow users to navigate between them.

meta.name: tag-group
meta.description: A tag group is a focusable list of labels, categories, keywords, filters, or other items, with support for keyboard navigation, selection, and removal.

meta.name: time-field
meta.description: A time field allows users to enter and edit time values using a keyboard. Each part of a time value is displayed in an individually editable segment.

meta.name: toggle
meta.description: A toggle button allows a user to toggle a selection on or off, for example switching between two states or modes.

meta.name: tooltip
meta.description: A tooltip displays a description of an element on hover or focus.
